original: HARLIN, Axel Harald, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Kkrona 8/6 90 av flaggstyrm C A F H o Jenny Pettersson, gm Astrid Lindström. Mog.ex Kkrona 09, KTH (E) 10-13. Anst v Elektr o Mek Prövn.anst Sthlm 14—18, Hemsjö Kraft AB Karlshamn 18—20, Sydsv Kraft AB Malmö 20—21, Marma Sågv AB Söderhamn 21—24, IVA Sthlm sed. 24. Sekr i fi av IVA:s ktéer, i Svetskommiss o IVA:s korro-sionsnmd fr 36. Led av belysningsstyr Söderhamn 22, v. ordf där 23—24. Styr.led i Navi-gationssällsk 31—41 o i Svetstekn Frn sed. 42. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Av trycket: Träv.ind:s behov av kraft, bränsle o råvaror (IVA:s medd 26), Pappersmasseind :s kraft- o bränslebehov (ibid 26), Utbyte o avfall v sågverken (ibid 27), En noggrann ångmätn.metod (ibid 28), Fuel for domestic purposes, and the utilisa-tiori of waste wood in Sweden (28), Generalprovtagning av fuktigt träbränsle (31), Jämförande matlagningsprov mellan gas o elektricitet (31), Möjligheterna att ersätta kolbränsle m vedbränsle (33), Bränsleförbrukn i bostäder (33), Korrosionsnmdns långtidsförsök (41), Tekn revy i Sv Dagbl:s årsbok fr 36, nautiska o sjöhist upps mm. Red f Navis 35—39, f Svetskommiss :s 10-årsskr 41, f Svetsen fr 42. RVO, Navig.sällsk:s ftjGM. Hobbies: Nautik o sjöhistoria.
translated: HARLIN, Axel Harald, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Kkrona on 8/6 1890, son of flag officer C.A.F.H and Jenny Pettersson, married to Astrid Lindström. Completed military service in Kkrona in 1909, studied at KTH (E) from 1910 to 1913. Employed by Elektr o Mek Prövn.anst in Stockholm from 1914 to 1918, Hemsjö Kraft AB in Karlshamn from 1918 to 1920, Sydsv Kraft AB in Malmö from 1920 to 1921, Marma Sågv AB in Söderhamn from 1921 to 1924, and has been with IVA Stockholm since 1924. Secretary in various committees of IVA, as well as in the Welding Commission and IVA's corrosion board since 1936. Member of the lighting board of Söderhamn from 1922, and vice chairman from 1923 to 1924. Board member of the Navigation Society from 1931 to 1941, and of the Swedish Welding Technology Association since 1942. Member of the Swedish Technical Research Society. Publications include: The wood industry's need for power, fuel, and raw materials (IVA's report 1926), The pulp industry's power and fuel requirements (ibid 1926), Exchange and waste from sawmills (ibid 1927), An accurate steam measurement method (ibid 1928), Fuel for domestic purposes, and the utilization of waste wood in Sweden (1928), General sampling of moist wood fuel (1931), Comparative cooking test between gas and electricity (1931), Possibilities to replace coal fuel with firewood (1933), Fuel consumption in housing (1933), Long-term experiments of the corrosion board (1941), Technical reviews in the Swedish Daily's yearbook from 1936, nautical and maritime historical essays, etc. Editor of Navis from 1935 to 1939, editor of the Welding Commission's 10-year publication in 1941, and of the journal Svetsen since 1942. Recipient of the Royal Victorian Order, honorary member of the Navigation Society. Hobbies: Navigation and maritime history.
